title: Companies worldwide are caught up by growing urge to merge
text:
Welcome to your preview of The Times Subscribe now Companies worldwide are caught up by growing urge to merge Pfizer failed in its hostile pursuit of AstraZeneca Andrew Kelly/Reuters Deirdre Hipwell M&A Correspondent Published at 12:01AM, October 12 2015 
The boom in mergers and acquisitions worldwide shows no signs of easing, with levels of transaction activity already close to surpassing the total achieved last year. 
Research from Boston Consulting Group shows that the total value of M&A deals recorded in the first half of the year has already reached 65 per cent of the entire value of all transactions in 2014 — a result, it said, of “multiple huge and high-impact deals announced in industries such as energy, media, healthcare, consumer products and financial services”.
